oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Resistance or Susceptibility to Production-Related Metabolic Diseases (PRMDs) Can be Predicted with Fecal and Erythrocyte Isotopic Signatures
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Roeder, B. L.
Yamada, N.
Ford, J. C. A.
Maharjan, S.
Nguyen, J. D.
Eggett, D. L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: RBC isotopic signatures
close-up
parturient
N SIA
resistance
susceptibility
PRMD
Production-Related Metabolic Diseases
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Feces and RBC isotopic signatures in close-up and parturient cows correctly classified -75% as healthy or at PRMD risk. Measuring C and N SIA as a management tool during the peripartum period may provide an economical method to identify cow resistance or susceptibility to PRMD, for retention, breeding, early treatment intervention, or culling decisions to increase profit margins.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2011; 188
